name: Monstera Deliciousa
description: The large foliage of the mature plants has striking fenestration and this exotic-looking plant is super easy to grow indoors. Individual leaves grow to be up to 3 feet long and with its upward vining growth habit and aerial roots it grows best up against a pole or trellis. https://thursd.com/articles/types-of-monstera

name: Monstera Thai Constellation
description: The splotchy creamy white and yellow pattern on the fenestrated foliage results in a unique form of variegation that for some enthusiasts makes it a worthwhile investment. https://costafarms.com/blogs/plant-finder/monstera

name: Monstera Albo
description: It looks similar to Thai Constellation but the splotchy white patterns can develop to be pure white on some leaves of mature specimens. https://plnts.com/en/blog/monstera-varieties-the-ultimate-guide

name: Monstera Peru
description: If you're looking for a compact monstera with beautiful individual patterns on its thick foliage consider the variegated variety of the Monstera Peru. Just remember that this plant won't develop fenestrations on its foliage regardless of how mature it is. https://peaceloveandhappiness.club/products/monstera-obliqua-peru

name: Monstera Mint
description: The mint Monstera is a variegated variety of Monstera that has a unique and attractive mint coloring setting it apart from other variegated plants which often have yellow or white flecks of color. https://plantproper.com/products/monstera-mint

name: Monstera Standleyana
description: This rare compact monstera species stands out for its unusual and unpredictable individual foliage color variations often appearing as white or yellow splashes on long lanceolate leaves. https://plnts.com/en/blog/monstera-varieties-the-ultimate-guide

name: Monstera Half Moon
description: High Variegated White Monstera Adansonii Albo in a Nursery Pot featuring Half-Moon Swiss Cheese Variegated Plant patterns that split the leaf down the middle. https://www.etsy.com/market/monstera_halfmoon

name: Monstera Aurea
description: The Aurea features the same attractive foliage as the other non-variegated Monsteras but with the addition of some fairly spectacular yellow variegations that can appear as sectors or marbling. https://www.plantvault.com/blogs/blog/top-7-rare-monstera-houseplants

name: Monstera Burle Marx Flame
description: Often confused with dilacerata this variety features narrow ribcage-like foliage that resembles flames and has a thick cardboard texture. https://monsteraplantresource.com/monstera-dilacerata-monstera-burle-marx-flame-care-guide/

name: Monstera Esqueleto
description: Formerly known as epipremnoides this large species features massive fenestrations that extend from the midrib to the leaf margin creating a skeleton look. https://www.lovethatleaf.co.nz/blogs/plant-care-guides/which-monstera-is-it

name: Monstera Adansonii Laniata
description: A subspecies of adansonii that is larger and glossier with deciduous petiole wings and fenestrations that are more evenly spaced near the midrib. https://stevesleaves.com/products/monstera-adansonii-ssp-laniata

name: Monstera Subpinnata
description: This species features distinct pinnate leaves that look like palm fronds with segments completely separated to the midrib giving a fern-like appearance. https://stevesleaves.com/products/monstera-subpinnata

name: Monstera Dubia
description: A shingling species that starts with small heart-shaped silver variegated leaves pressed flat against a tree before transforming into large fenestrated mature foliage. https://mountaincrestgardens.com/monstera-dubia-shingle-plant/

name: Monstera Siltepecana
description: Known as Silver Monstera this plant has lanceolate leaves with silver markings in its juvenile stage and develops fenestrations as it climbs and matures. https://spokaneplantfarm.com/products/monstera-slitepecana

name: Monstera Pinnatipartita
description: Juvenile leaves are bullate and textured while mature leaves become deeply split and pinnatifid resembling a rugged deliciosa. https://stevesleaves.com/products/monstera-pinnatipartita

name: Monstera Obliqua
description: Famous for being more hole than leaf the Peru form of this species is extremely fragile and features large fenestrations with very thin leaf tissue. https://www.thesill.com/products/monstera-obliqua

name: Monstera Acuminata
description: A shingling species similar to adansonii but with pointed acuminate leaves that grow flat against surfaces in the juvenile stage. https://www.rhs.org.uk/plants/156662/monstera-acuminata-shingle-plant/details

name: Monstera Spruceana
description: A pinnate species where juvenile leaves shingle flat against the host while mature leaves become large and deeply divided similar to subpinnata. https://stevesleaves.com/products/monstera-spruceana

name: Monstera Aureopinnata
description: A climbing species from Peru that features pinnate leaves and can exhibit striking golden variegation especially in bright light. https://ecuageneraus.com/products/monstera-aureopinnata

name: Monstera Tuberculata
description: A shingling species with leathery oval leaves that lack fenestrations and produces a unique pendulous inflorescence with tuberculate spadix. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monstera_tuberculata

name: Monstera Tenuis
description: This species shingles with an alternating leaf pattern and develops deep cuts in its thin mature leaves found natively in Costa Rica. https://stevesleaves.com/products/monstera-tenuis-5-5-pot

name: Monstera Vasquezii
description: Known as Crocodile Monstera this species has a textured leaf surface and is related to dubia but generally lacks perforations. https://www.gbif.org/species/2868230

name: Monstera Filamentosa
description: An extremely rare shingler where mature fenestrations are so extensive that the leaf tissue forms thin thread-like filaments connecting the veins. https://aabexotics.com/products/monstera-filamentosa-extremely-rare

name: Monstera Membranacea
description: This species features incredibly thin membranous leaves with large fenestrations and resembles Amydrium medium due to convergent evolution. https://powo.science.kew.org/taxon/urn:lsid:ipni.org:names:163941-2/general-information

name: Monstera Deliciosa Sierrana
description: A rare variety from Oaxaca with smaller leaves that are deeply dissected with narrow lobes and sinuses extending almost to the midrib. https://herebutnot.com/monstera-deliciosa-var-sierrana-burle-marx-flame-dilacerata-and-var-brazil/

name: Monstera Deliciosa Tauerii
description: A dwarf cultivar of deliciosa that stays compact and develops fenestrations at a much younger age than the standard species. https://www.ufseeds.com/product/tauerii-monstera---50-seeds/HPMD-50Seeds.html

name: Monstera White Tears
description: A rare mint variegation form of deliciosa where the leaves feature delicate irregular white and mint marbling resembling tears. https://palmstreet.app/product/xVdpPPtt3KCAkPaZ0xi0C/monstera-white-tears-full-mint

name: Monstera Punctulata
description: Named for the spotted petioles this species has soft bright green leaves with high fenestration levels and is often found in Central America. https://www.gbif.org/species/2868198

name: Monstera Barrieri
description: A shingling species from French Guiana that climbs upward with thick velvety juvenile leaves and jagged structured mature foliage. https://aabexotics.com/blogs/news/monstera-barrieri

name: Monstera Bocatorensis
description: Endemic to Panama this robust climber features large elongated leaves with striking deep incisions and is sought after by collectors. https://casa-botanica.com/en/products/monstera_bocatorensis

name: Monstera Frozen Freckles
description: A variegated cultivar of adansonii with a unique blister or mint pattern where leaves appear speckled with icy white and green. https://www.foliage-factory.com/monstera-adansonii-frozen-freckles

name: Monstera Mint Siam
description: A rare cultivar of deliciosa displaying marbled mint green and white variegation that is often more stable than pure white sectors. https://siamplantes.com/products/monstera-siam-mint

name: Monstera Medusa
description: A mutation of deliciosa featuring twisted contorted leaves with unique fenestrations and often marbled variegation. https://floristapearlstore.com/products/copy-monstera-thai-constellation-platinum

name: Monstera Vietciosa
description: A rumored hybrid or distinct form with thick leaves and stunning variegation that produces edible fruit with a mix of tropical flavors. https://theleafexchange.com/products/monstera-vietciosa-pot-code-96-pre-order-high-variegation-3-5-inch-pot-size

name: Monstera Lime Light
description: A cultivar selected for its bright lime green foliage and distinctive fenestrations which can intensify with bright light exposure. https://www.thebasements.com/products/monstera-lime-light

name: Monstera Adansonii Archipelago
description: A rare variegated form of adansonii known for ghost leaves that emerge white and slowly green up or maintain unstable white sectors. https://www.thebasements.com/products/us-seller-monstera-adansonii-archipelago

name: Monstera Lechleriana
description: A large climber similar to adansonii but with a tighter internode stack and large oval leaves that develop fewer fenestrations near the midrib. https://www.gabriellaplants.com/products/monstera-lechleriana-variegated

name: Monstera Xanthospatha
description: A high elevation Colombian species often confused with obliqua but distinguished by its yellow spathe and generally more robust habit. https://www.houseofkojo.com/products/monstera-obliqua-xanthospatha

name: Monstera Gracilis
description: A slender root-climbing species from Colombia with delicate membranous pinnatifid leaves and a rare status in cultivation. https://casa-botanica.com/en/products/monstera_gracilis

name: Monstera Praetermissa
description: Meaning overlooked this Brazilian species belongs to the obliqua complex and produces leaves with large circular midrib fenestrations. https://www.monstera-app.com/en/plants/varieties/monstera-praetermissa-01JDSW8P7HZE476836RQF56Z44

name: Monstera Molinae
description: A Costa Rican endemic that fenestrates with jagged unequal pinnate edges and often adopts a pendant hanging habit at maturity. https://www.monsterax.com/l/642688c8-dd3e-4ef0-a816-a216b3ce7625

name: Monstera Tacanaensis
description: Native to Mexico and Guatemala this species resembles deliciosa but is smaller and found at higher elevations with specific floral traits. https://casa-botanica.com/en/products/monstera_tacanaensis

name: Monstera Kessleri
description: A Bolivian species with large fenestrated leaves that is often confused with lechleriana but distinct in its geographic origin and floral morphology. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monstera_kessleri

name: Monstera Platinum
description: A premium mutation of Thai Constellation featuring silvery cream variegation that is often more subtle and metallic than the standard form. https://www.fordplants.de/product-page/monstera-platinum?lang=en

name: Monstera Ocean Mint
description: A variety of deliciosa that features a mottled pattern creating irregular curled leaf edges and white streaks resembling ocean waves. https://www.thebasements.com/products/us-seller-monstera-deliciosa-ocean-mint-supper-rare
